Articles.Content:
Hey there,

I've lurked here a buit, and have been playing kerbal for about a month now.

I've managed to complete a few of my goals such as:

-Successful launch into Orbit of Planet Kerban

-Successful Orbit of Kerban

-Successful Re-entry of kerban and Parachut landing within resonable distance of space center.

-Successful Launch to the Mun, Orbit, Return to Kerbal and parachute landing.

I'm working on doing some landings now, but my last Mun trip I had barely enough fuel to burn back to Kerban. I add more fuel but it usually makes the rocket longer and a bit more wobbly. It feels like a never ending battle of adding fuel, which weights down the craft, so ir needs more fuel....etc etc.

I'm also hoping to use less propellant for the RCS thrusters as they seem to run out quickly too.

Anyways, glad to be here, and I hope to have some flags planted soon.

Welcome to KSP

Take a look at some of the tutorials on the wiki site. That might help you with some of your rocket building issues.

Also, you shouldn't need to much RCS. If you have a command pod that holds 2-3 kerbals, it should spin and move without RCS.

The game has a learning curve, but since you are getting to the moon, you'll figure it out pretty quickly.

Thanks!

I'm definitly trying my best, and I hope to have made a succesful landing on Minnimus or the Mun soon!
